cards.title: getch() for Windows returns an int not a char

Fred might have time to test the fix sometime this week

Didn't work! Looks like I made it worse LOL

OK 3rd time's the charm, this should work

cards.title: Theme / Story / Ideas
cards.description:
- [ ] Priority #1 prevent other ships from reaching Earth
- [ ] Secondary objective: defend that "Plan B" planet I can't remember the name of
- [ ] Explore and move about stealthily. If discovered you must kill them before they jump away
- [ ] Have Skippy do crazy-ass moves to destroy other ships
- [ ] Train Spec-ops
- [ ] Raid Stations with Spec-ops for Food, Fuel, Missiles and Elder or Alien artifacts
- [ ] Research artifacts
- [ ] Have the races wage war against each other. Ships leave a race's shipyard to go attack another race's planet
- [ ] Have some researchers leave a race's research station to head towards Earth once in a while
- [ ] Learn in advance about the researchers headed for Earth by visiting Stations
- [ ] Read the news in stations to learn about ships of that race leaving a station to wage war on another race

 - [ ] Research

cards.title: All planets and asteroids have the same name
cards.description:
WTH !? I'm pretty sure I'm not doing it wrong :-/

No they don't, I was printing the name of the last iteration instead of the current one... DUH!

star, name, system_x, system_y, color, symbol

coordinates are centered around the star

cards.title: Support arrow keys
cards.description:
Arrow up is 27 + 91 + 65 in Linux
            27 + 224 + 0 in Windows (not sure last)

So it's not too hard, if 27 call getch again etc.

But 27 is the ESC key so if you press ESC you get stuck with the second getch :-(

The real solution seems to be rewrite for curses but I don't want to at all now.

DEFERRED
